intro: Lippia grisea var. latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf gray lippia, is a perennial shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It features aromatic, narrow to broad leaves that are typically grayish-green in color, with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. This species is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils due to its aromatic properties.
